sn12.48:4.2: Then a brahmin cosmologist went up to the Buddha …
sn12.48:4.3: Seated to one side he said to the Buddha:
sn12.48:5.2: “‘All exists’: this is the oldest cosmology, brahmin.”
sn12.48:6.2: “‘All doesn’t exist’: this is the second cosmology.
sn12.48:7.2: “‘All is a unity’: this is the third cosmology.
sn12.48:8.2: “‘All is a plurality’: this is the fourth cosmology.
sn12.48:9.1: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One teaches by the middle way:
sn12.48:9.3: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.48:9.4: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.48:9.5: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.48:9.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn12.48:10.1: When he said this, the brahmin cosmologist said to the Buddha:
sn12.48:10.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
